title: How to Make Roasted Cayenne Walnuts

steps.headline: Crush the cloves with the back of a knife.
Pour the oil into the oven-proof pan.
steps.description: Add the chopped garlic. Heat gently.

steps.headline: Add the walnuts and cayenne pepper.
steps.description: Heat through briefly, a minute or so. Do not let brown; don't leave unattended.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat.
steps.description: Using a spatula or similar implement, spread the walnuts across the base of the pan in a single layer. Avoid having walnuts sit atop one another.

steps.headline: Place in the oven to roast.
steps.description: Leave for about 15 minutes or until the walnuts look golden brown. During roasting, while wearing oven mitts, shake the pan occasionally. Or, use tongs and turn the walnuts over by hand. This helps them to roast evenly.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven.

steps.description: These can be eaten hot or cold. They're delicious hot on a cold winter's day or eve; they're also fine cold.

text: Preparing the Garlic Peel the garlic cloves. Discard the peel. Crush the cloves with the back of a knife. The chop finely. Frying the Walnuts Pour the oil into the oven-proof pan. Add the chopped garlic. Heat gently. Add the walnuts and cayenne pepper. Heat through briefly, a minute or so. Do not let brown; don't leave unattended. Remove from the heat. Using a spatula or similar implement, spread the walnuts across the base of the pan in a single layer. Avoid having walnuts sit atop one another. Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF.  Roasting the Walnuts Place in the oven to roast. Leave for about 15 minutes or until the walnuts look golden brown. During roasting, while wearing oven mitts, shake the pan occasionally. Or, use tongs and turn the walnuts over by hand. This helps them to roast evenly. Remove from the oven. Sprinkle with salt to taste while cooling. Serve. These can be eaten hot or cold. They're delicious hot on a cold winter's day or eve; they're also fine cold.
